page.title: 12 Preserving Strelley Hall
page.content: Marian Henshell says: "We have to have permission to alter the outside of the hall. In fact all we've done is alter the old kitchen by putting in four new windows. We can do what we like to the inside of the hall but we want to preserve it. We've made certain rooms into offices. In fact, even Miss Edge's bathroom we've made into an office. But if we've moved anything we've always tried to use it elsewhere, even the brass taps. We've altered the stables very little. We've kept the stalls and the mangers and the hay racks and the floor. All the panelling from the stables we have used to panel the lower parts of the walls in our new lounge, which used to be the servants' hall and the housekeeper's room and store rooms."
